description: A proposed sand and gravel pitt near the Abbotsford Airport.
name: 29694 Marshall Road Extension

proponent.name: Rigby Farmlands Limited and Little Rock Quarries

description: The Project is a modification to the already substantially completed liquid nitrogen plant being built within the city boundaries of the City of Dawson Creek.  The major inputs in the creation of liquid nitrogen are air and electricity.  The only by-product of the process is clean water and oxygen.  The land on which the project is situated is privately owned by Air Liquide Canada Inc. (the Proponent) and is zoned for industrial use. The existing facility will produce 200 tonnes of liquid nitrogen per day, and the additional facility will produce 250 tonnes/daily, bringing the total to 450 tonnes/day or 164,250 tonnes/year.
name: Air Liquide Liquid Nitrogen Plant

description: KGHM Ajax Mining Inc.  proposes to develop a new open-pit copper and gold mine with a production capacity of up to 24 million tonnes of ore per year. The mine's life expectancy is 23 years.
name: Ajax Mine

description: Proposed 10,000 tonne per day open pit niobium mine 130 km north of Mackenzie, with a 25 year mine life.
name: Aley Mine

description: The proposed Project would involve developing a new open pit coal mine in north-western BC located about 90 km southeast of Iskut. With a production capacity of approximately 8,200 tonnes per day of clean coal, and a mine footprint of about 4000 ha, including an open pit of about 730 ha, the mine would produce about 3 million tonnes of coal for about 25 years. Transportation of the coal would be by rail to Ridley Terminals in Prince Rupert. The proposed Project would also include constructing a 147 km extension of an existing railway from its current terminus to the mine site.
name: Arctos Anthracite

description: EA Application referred to Ministers on February 2, 2005.  Assessment suspended on June 7, 2005 pending substantial completion of the Greater Vancouver Regional Solid Waste Management Plan amendment process.

description: Aurora Liquefied Natural Gas Ltd. proposes a Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) export facility with a full build out capacity to process up to 24 mtpa of LNG, including up to four LNG processing units, LNG storage tanks, and marine berth for loading of LNG vessels. The proposed project will be located in the Prince Rupert region sited at Digby Island.
name: Aurora LNG Digby Island

description: Aurora Liquefied Natural Gas Ltd. proposes a Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) export facility with a full build out capacity to process up to 24 mtpa of LNG, including up to four LNG processing units, LNG storage tanks, and marine berth for loading of LNG vessels. The proposed project will be located in the Prince Rupert region sited at Grassy Point.
name: Aurora LNG Grassy Point

description: Upgrading three existing bioremediation cells at the facility to achieve the requirements of the Hazardous Waste Regulation for Secure Landfill Cells, providing a direct waste disposal option for the oil and gas industry. The Project will accept soil from the same sources as the existing facility, as well as desiccant material, sulphur catalyst and salt-impacted soil. The Proponents intend to retain current bioremediation capacity, while adding capacity for the permanent storage of 750,000 tonnes of waste soil. The Project has an anticipated lifespan of 25-30 years.
name: Babkirk Secure Landfill

description: Upgrading three existing bioremediation cells at the facility to achieve the requirements of the Hazardous Waste Regulation for Secure Landfill Cells, providing a direct waste disposal option for the oil and gas industry. The Project will accept soil from the same sources as the existing facility, as well as desiccant material, sulphur catalyst and salt-impacted soil. The Proponents intend to retain current bioremediation capacity, while adding capacity for the permanent storage of 750,000 tonnes of waste soil. The Project has an anticipated lifespan of 25-30 years.
name: Babkirk Special Waste Treatment Facility

description: Teck Coal Limited (Proponent) proposes to extend Elkview Operations through the Baldy Ridge Extension project. The proposed Project would increase the disturbance area by 862 ha and would have a production capacity of 6.8 million tonnes/year of clean coal. The proposed Project is located 2.5 km east of Sparwood in south-east BC.

description: The Basal Aquifer Dewatering project will increase the rate of groundwater extraction from the Basal Aquifer to extend the Highland Valley Copper Mine life by 3.5 years.

description: Project consists of the extraction of gold and silver from an open pit mine, and ore processing facilities with a milling rate capacity of 60,000 t/d (22 Mt/y), over 17 years. The production capacity would be approximately 2.25 million metric tonnes/year of clean coal with a mine footprint of about 1,000 ha. The mine would produce a total of 76.5 million metric tonnes of clean coal over the estimated mine life of 34 years.

description: The proposed Project would involve the construction and operation of an approximately 650 km long natural gas pipeline 1219 mm (48 inches) diameter from near the community of GroundBirch (40 km west of Dawson Creek) in northeast BC to the proposed LNG Canada LNG export facility near Kitimat. description: The Project is a modification to the already substantially complete liquid nitrogen plant being built within the city boundaries of the City of Dawson Creek. The major inputs in the creation of liquid nitrogen are air and electricity. The only by-product of the process is clean water and oxygen. The land on which the project is situated is privately owned by Ferus Inc. (the Proponent) and is zoned for industrial use. The existing facility will produce 180 tonnes of liquid nitrogen per day, and the additional facility will produce the same, bringing the total to 260 tonnes/day or 131,400 tonnes/year. The Proponent has been advised by the BC Archeology Branch that archaeological records for the parcel of land on which the project site is located do not indicate the presence of a known archaelogical site, nor any potential for an unrecorded archaeological site.
name: Dawson Creek Liquid Nitrogen Plant

description: We're changing B.C.'s environmental assessment process to ensure the legal rights of First Nations are respected and the public’s expectation of a strong, transparent process is met. The Discussion Paper outlines the proposed changes to B.C.'s environmental assessment process, please ensure you've read it before submitting your comment. The Discussion Paper can be accessed on the following page under "View Related Documents". Click on the "View Comment" button below to review the Discussion Paper and submit your comment.

description: WindRiver Power Corporation proposes to develop the Kinskuch Hydroelectric Project, a 50 to 80 megawatt power project located approximately 150 kilometres north of Terrace, BC. description: Kitimat Clean Ltd. (Proponent) proposes to develop and operate an oil refinery and associated infrastructure to supply refined fuels to Asian markets. Refined fuel products would be delivered from the refinery site, approximately 13 km north of Kitimat, to a new marine terminal, approximately 12 km south of Kitimat harbour, using three 23 km long pipelines and from there transported by ship to Asia. The Kitimat Clean Refinery Project (Kitimat Clean) would be in operation for up to 50 years, following a construction period of up to 5 years. The Proponent expects decommissioning to take an additional 5 years.
name: Kitimat Clean Refinery

description: Meadows Quarry Group is proposing a 7.5 ha quarry on the south side of Sheridan Hill in the City of Pitt Meadows. It would have an annual extraction rate of 240,000 tonnes/year of construction aggregate, and would be in operation over a five-year period.

description: North Coal is proposing to develop the Michel Coal Project. The proposed Project, which is located on privately owned fee simple lands approximately 15 km southeast of Sparwood, includes: An annual production of 2.3 - 4 million tonnes raw coal; A mine life of 15-30  years; and An initial estimate of project disturbance footprint over the 10-year life-of-mine of approximately 1,926 ha. North Coal Limited is a Canadian resource company based in Sparwood, BC, and is a wholly owned subsidiary of North Coal Pty Ltd (North Coal Pty), a private Australian resource development company.
name: Michel Coal

description: Alaska Hydro Corporation proposes to develop the More Creek Hydroelectric Project, a 75 megawatt hydroelectric project with reservoir storage with an approximate average annual energy output of 348 gigawatt hour (GWh). The proposed reservoir storage would inundate an area of approximately 2104 ha extending 20 km upstream from the Project intake and create a reservoir with a total surface area of 2680 ha. The proposed Project is located 130 km north of the town of Stewart in northwestern British Columbia and 95 km east from the border of British Columbia and Alaska.
name: More Creek Hydroelectric

description: Vancouver-based Pacific Future Energy Corporation is proposing to build and operate a petroleum oil refinery in northwest B.C. between the City of Terrace and the District Municipality of Kitimat within an industrial-zoned site locally known as Dubose Flats. The proposed project would refine up to 200,000 barrels per day (or 31,795 cubic meters per day (m3/d)) of Canadian bitumen into diesel, gasoline, and other products for domestic and international markets. Bitumen would be shipped in a near-solid form called neatbit in rail cars using existing rail infrastructure.zoned site locally known as Dubose Flats. The proposed project would refine Canadian bitumen into diesel, gasoline, and other products. Bitumen would be shipped from Alberta and Saskatchewan in a near-solid form called neatbit in rail cars using existing rail infrastructure.
name: Pacific Future Energy Refinery

description: Pacific NorthWest LNG Limited Partnership proposes to construct and operate an LNG export facility on Lelu Island at the Port of Prince Rupert, BC. The project would be developed in two phases with a total capital cost of US $18 billion, and would include a marine terminal and liquefaction plant with three trains (production units), and a storage capacity of 540,000 m3 with a production capacity of up to 18 million tonnes per year of liquefied natural gas.
name: Pacific NorthWest LNG

description: Pacific Northern Gas Ltd. (Proponent) proposes to construct and operate an approximately 525km long, 610mm (24") diameter natural gas pipeline from Summit Lake, BC to Kitimat, BC to loop the Proponent's existing natural gas pipeline. The proposed Project would supply natural gas to proposed liquefied natural gas (LNG) export facilities as well as the Proponent's existing customers. The proposed Project would include the replacement of four existing compressor stations and would have an initial capacity of 600 million standard cubic feet per day (MMscfd).
name: Pacific Northern Gas Looping

description: Project consists of construction of a new 470 km, 36" natural gas pipeline between Summit Lake and Kitimat BC along current and new rights-of-way. Project may also include one or more new compressor stations along the pipeline. (formerly known as Kitimat-Summit Lake Pipeline Looping Project)
name: Pacific Trail Pipelines

The Project Description (dated May 21, 2013) and associated updates (dated July 15 and August 14, 2013) provide an overview of the proposed Project.

description: Interoute Contruction Ltd. proposes a 12 hectare expansion of its existing Revelstoke West Side Road Gravel Pit, while Revelstoke Sand and Gravel proposes a new 8 hectare gravel pit. description: The Musqueam Indian Band and Bastion Development Corporation are proposing to develop a commercial marina for recreational vessels at Richmond Island.  The proposed development would include boat launch, boat gantry crane, gangway and ramps, dredging of slough, approximately 9,000 linear feet of dock space for 174 in-water moorage slips, dry-stack storage for up to 250 boats, parking for 228 vehicles, 5,000 square feet (280 sq. m) space for a marine trades and boat repairs, 7,000 square feet  (650 sq. m) space for a cafe, marine supplies store, caretaker's residences and other commercial uses. Installation of water, sanitary and electric connections,  creation of a habitat island,  pedestrian and cycling pathway along an existing access road connecting Bentley Street to Richmond Island,  public observation point, and an accessible park.
name: Richmond Island Milltown Marina and Boatyard

description: WesPac Midstream-Vancouver LLC is proposing to construct the WesPac Tilbury Marine Jetty Project (Tilbury Marine Jetty) at Tilbury Island on the Fraser River in Delta, BC. Tilbury Marine Jetty includes the berthing and transferring of liquefied natural gas (LNG) to marine barges and carriers for delivery to local fuel markets and offshore export markets. Tilbury Marine Jetty will require the removal of existing abandoned marine infrastructure, the construction of a new marine jetty (access trestle, loading platform and mooring dolphins), the construction of LNG infrastructure to receive processed LNG for transfer to marine vessels and safety and process control systems. The supply of LNG for Tilbury Marine Jetty will come via a pipeline from the existing adjacent FortisBC Tilbury LNG Plant.
name: WesPac Tilbury Marine Jetty

description: The Proponent plans to develop  a natural gas transmission system from the Cypress area in northeast BC to the Prince Rupert area. It will include 851 km to 872 km of 912 mm to 1219 mm diameter pipeline and up to five compressor stations.
name: Westcoast Connector Gas Transmission

description: Proposed creation of a habitat banking site along the southeast shore of Westham Island in Canoe Pass by Port Metro Vancouver
name: Westham Canoe Pass Tidal Marsh

description: Proponent receives provincial approval for the construction of a nordic facility for 2010 Olympics. Certificate was signed on April 5 2005.
name: Whistler Nordic Centre

proponent.name: Vancouver Organizing Committee for the 2010 Olympic and Pagalympic Winter Games

description: Finavera Renewables Inc. proposes to construct and operate 37 wind turbines with an installed capacity of 74 MW. The purpose is to provide clean energy for BC and has a life span of at least 25 years.
name: Wildmare Wind Energy

description: Western Coal Corp is proposing to expand the Willow Creek coal mine which requires an amendment to the Environmental Assessment Certificate.
name: Willow Creek

description: Proponent receives provincial approval to construct a new coal mine near Tumbler Ridge. Amendment to Environmental Assessment Certificate M04-01, and Mine Permit No. C-223 received June 3 2005
name: Wolverine Coal Mine

description: Tervita Corporation is proposing to develop a secure landfill approximately 48 km northwest of Dawson Creek, BC (formerly known as CCS Wolverine Secure Landfill Project).
name: Wolverine Secure Landfill

description: SECURE Energy Services Inc. proposes to construct and operate the Wonowon Landfill Project, which is anticipated to handle approximately 200,000 tonnes of waste annually over a 25-75 year lifespan, dependent on disposal services demand.
name: Wonowon Landfill

description: Woodfibre LNG Limited (Proponent) proposes to construct and operate a liquefied natural gas export facility on the previous Woodfibre Pulp and Paper Mill site located approximately 7 km west-southwest of the urban centre of Squamish, British Columbia. The facility would have a storage capacity of 250,000 m3 and would produce up to 2.1 million tonnes per year of liquefied natural gas.
name: Woodfibre LNG
